title: 15 Retro Sneakers Fashion Girls Are Trading Their Sambas For
description: The vintage-inspired styles are undeniably chic.
excerpt: The best retro sneakers are having quite a moment right now. Read on to find out about the trend that's back from the past.

html:
The Nostalgic Find

Adidas Originals Tokyo Sneakers

This reissued silhouette is an update on a vintage design that was originally released in the 1960s, and it’s ten times cooler than any Samba.

The Latest Drop

Chloé Kick Mesh and Leather Low-Top Sneakers

Between the mesh insets, the leather panels, and the sumptuous suede, there’s so much to love here.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

The Affordable

Zara Suede Sneaekers

If you’re not quite sure how the retro silhouette will look on you, test it out with this affordable pair that comes in an on-trend chocolate brown hue.

The Viral Star

Puma Speedcat OG Sneaker

One of the most sought after pairs of retro sneakers comes from Puma. Grab this coveted red pair while you can because it constantly sells out.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

The Twinkle Toes

Dries Van Noten Metallic Sneakers

A metallic touch is exactly what all of your “jeans and T-shirt” looks need this winter.

The New Neutrals

Mango Canvas Sneakers With Leather Panels

With ivory and beige panels, Mango makes the retro sneaker trend look undeniably elegant.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

The Gender Neutral Hero

Onitsuka Tiger Mexico 66 Sneaker

Thanks to its instantly recognizable striped logo, Onitsuka Tiger’s 1960s-inspired kicks are one of the most famous pairs on the list.

The Fuzzy Suede Pair

Nike Cortez Vintage

The streamlined silhouette gets a modern update in this cozy pair of Nike Cortez sneakers.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

The Fall Essential

Steve Madden Mirage Sneaker

If you’re thinking about the season’s biggest color trends, don’t forget about the undeniable allure of burgundy.

The Best Collaboration

Wales Bonner x Adidas Originals Edition MN Samba Sneakers

When it comes to unstoppable collaborations, Wales Bonner and Adidas always take the cake. This time, the duo served up unexpected color and fabric pairings to create the perfect retro-inspired sneaker.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

The Suede Mash-up

New Balance X Miu Miu 530 SL Suede sneakers

Speaking of collaborations, New Balance and Miu Miu’s link up is one not to miss. The Milanese house makes the timeless 530s look cooler than ever.

The Pop of Color

Spalwart Marathon Trail Sneakers

This shoe truly has history. The Swedish brand really did their research and used an actual mold from a relic Slovakian shoe factory to create this stunner.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

The Minimalist Magic

Toteme The Sport Suede-Trimmed Sneakers

If you’re in need of a style that whispers chic, look no further. Toteme subtly incorporated its logo in suede and wool fabrics on this retro-inspired pair of sneakers.

The Expertly Crafted Design

The Row Owen Leather & Mesh Sneaker

The mixing and matching of fabrics continues on The Row’s charming sneakers, with Nappa leather and soft mesh.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

The Boundary Breaker

Ann Demeulemeester Sami Low-Top Boxing Sneakers

Taking most of its inspo from the early days of boxing, Ann Demeulemeester makes a chic case for marrying the sporty with the fashion-forward.

Why Trust ELLE?

Every product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.
